writing_prompt: A master art forger turned FBI consultant finds himself at a crossroads when his old partner proposes a heist that feels... wrong. For the first time, he hesitates—has he really changed, or is he just fooling himself?

When Crowley ran into Dean Winchester after years apart, he never expected it to lead to late-night confessions, stolen kisses, and a life tangled with federal agents and family barbecues. But some things, it seems, are worth rewriting the plan for.

A con artist turned FBI consultant accidentally finds himself defending proper legal procedures during a heated case discussion—much to the amusement of his by-the-book handler, who never lets him live it down.

The starship is stranded, dead in space, with no apparent reason for the failure. As the clock ticks down and theories crumble, the chief engineer must uncover the truth before the crew's time runs out.

When a relentless agent arrives to audit Peter's team, Neal finds himself under suspicion for a forgery he didn’t commit. To clear his name—and protect Peter—he hatches a plan that might just blur the line between clever and reckless.
